intro: Trachystoma longivalve, commonly known as the long-valved trachystoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster. Its flowering period typically occurs during the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Trachystoma longivalve is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
